sections.description:
Glocal elements style default HTML Elements and user generated content or WYSIWYG editors. It also includes common patterns that are reused thoughout the site like Typography, Images, SVGs, Forms, Lists, and print styles.

Naming Patterns

 p ul li (Default HTML Elements)
.g-global-style__element
.g-global-style--modifier
.g-global-style--modifier__element
.g-global-style__element--modifier

Components are discreet parts of the UI. They general can scale to fit a range of sizes of containers (See Layouts).

Components can appear inside components. Components May adjust their own layouts depending on the size of their containers. This is typical done with eq.js script for element queries.

Naming Patterns

.c-component__element
.c-component--modifier
.c-component--modifier__element
.c-component__element--modifier

sections.description:
Custom Layouts

Layouts position components in a page. They often implenent width based Media queries in a mobile first strategy. Typically there is a layout partial for different regions in the website like the page (wrapper), header, footer, etc. These Layouts tend to be unique and not reusable.

Naming Patterns

.l-layout__element
.l-layout--variation
.l-layout--modifier__element
.l-layout__element--modifier
.l-header
.l-header__logo
.l-header__tagline
.l-header--sticky >> EG. the header is smaller & fixed postion when you scroll...
.l-header--sticky__logo

Reusable Layouts

Media Queries

Other layouts are reusable such as generic grid containers. These can be either (width) media query or eq.js based layouts. Column layouts express the number of columns with a "cols#" string, and a optionally a modifer which expresses the number of columns the layout has from smallest width to largest width.

Yes you can indeed used brackets and commas in css if you escape with a backslash

Media Query Patterns

.l-2cols >> 2 columns (equal width)
.l-2cols--1-2 >> 1 column @ default width, 2 columns @ larger width
.l-5col--1-2-5 >> 1 to 2 to 5 columns as the width increases
.l-2cols(25,75) >> 2 columns in ratio of 25% to 75%

eq.js

eq.js "breakpoints" are defined in HTML. This allows them to be more flexible as you can simply add or remove "data-eq-pts" in your data attibutes of the layout wrapper class. Details are in the eq.js docs.

<div class="l-eq" data-eq-pts="l-eq--2col: 400 l-eq--3col: 600"> CONTENT </div>

eq.js Patterns 

.l-eq--2cols >> 2 columns when
.l-eq--5cols
.l-eq--2col--1-2(60,40)  <-- 1="" 2="" to="" columns.="" columns="" in="" ratio="" of="" 60%="" 40%="" .="" <="" pre="">

Generic modifier components. Oftern extended from other components. Each Utility should be very specific and do only 1 job. This seciton also documents Generic Mixins and Extendables

Utility Naming Patterns

.u-utility__element
.u-utility--modifier
.u-utility--modifier__element
.u-utility__element--modifier

Mixin Naming Patterns @TODO

variables.name: baseline
variables.value:
rem($base-line-height), // font baseline
    $svg-width: ru(0.75), // SVG width (units same as typography)
    $svg-height: ru(0.75), // SVG height
    $svg-pad-right: ru(0.25), // padding on right side of SVG
    $svg-pad-left: 0, // padding on left side of SVG
    $container-vertical-padding: ru(0.5), // Top & bottom padding for container
    $container-padding-left: ru(1), // Left padding for container
    $container-padding-right: ru(1), // Right padding for container    $svg-class: 'svg', // Class for the SVG inside the parent
    $h-alignment: 'left', // Align Icon on 'left' or 'right'
    $v-alignment: 'top'

variables.name: baseline
variables.value:
rem($base-line-height), // font baseline
    $svg-width: ru(0.75), // SVG width (units same as typography)
    $svg-height: ru(0.75), // SVG height
    $svg-pad-right: 0, // padding on left side of SVG
    $svg-pad-left: ru(0.5), // padding on right side of SVG
    $container-vertical-padding: ru(0.5), // Top & bottom padding for container
    $container-padding-left: ru(1), // Left padding for container
    $container-padding-right: ru(0.75), // Right padding for container
    $svg-class: 'svg', // Class for the SVG inside the parent
    $h-alignment: 'right', // Align Icon on 'left' or 'right'
    $v-alignment: 'top'

variables.name: palettes
variables.value:
(
  purple: (
    base: rgb(42, 40, 80),
    light: rgb(51, 46, 140),
    dark: rgb(40, 38, 65)
  ),
  grey: (
    base:  $_color-base-grey,
    light: lighten($_color-base-grey, 10%),
    dark: darken($_color-base-grey, 10%)
  )
) !default

variables.name: container-padding-right
variables.value:
0, // Right padding for container
  $container-padding-left: 0, // Left and right padding for container
  $svg-class: 'svg', // Class for the SVG inside the parent
  $h-alignment: 'left', // Align Icon on 'left' or 'right'
  $v-alignment: 'middle'

variables.name: palettes
variables.value:
(
  grey: (
    base: #939598,
    dark: #231f20,
    mediumlight: #afafaf,
    light: #e6e7e8,
    xlight: #f1f2f2
  )
)
